Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Waymo To Launch Robotaxi Service In Las Vegas, San Diego, Detroit In Major 2025 Expansion
| Reuters.com | November 3, 2025
Waymo said on Monday it will launch its robotaxi service in Las Vegas, San Diego and Detroit next year, marking its biggest geographic expansion yet.
B.)
Top 15 New Innovations Made Possible By AI
| YouTube.com | AI Uncovered | November 2, 2025
Discover how artificial intelligence is revolutionizing our world with groundbreaking innovations that redefine possibilities in various sectors. From advanced healthcare technologies to the emergence of autonomous systems, these developments are shaping the future and offering insights into a new era of intelligence that is unfolding right before our eyes.
C.)
OpenAI Board Used Secret Memo To Oust Altman And Attempted Failed Merger With Anthropic
| TheNeuron.ai | November 2, 2025
Ilya Sutskever‚Äôs secret deposition reveals he orchestrated Sam Altman‚Äôs firing using a 52-page memo filled with secondhand accusations from Mira Murati, culminating in a failed weekend plot by other board members to merge a collapsing OpenAI with Anthropic.
D.)
Adobe Unveils Experimental AI Tool That Edits Entire Videos From A Single Frame
| TheVerge.com | October 31, 2025
Adobe demonstrated some of the experimental AI tools it‚Äôs working on at its Max conference that provide new ways to intuitively edit photos, videos, and audio. These experiments, called ‚Äúsneaks,‚Äù include tools that instantly apply any changes you make to one frame across an entire video, easily manipulate light in images, and correct mispronunciations in audio recordings.
E.)
Google Debuts First Fully AI-Generated Ad Using Veo 3, Features Turkey To Avoid Uncanny Valley
| WSJ.com | October 31, 2025
The search giant becomes the biggest name yet to generate an ad entirely with its Veo 3 and other artificial-intelligence tools.
November 11, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | November 11, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
November 10, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
5.)
Build Hour: Agent RFT
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | November 10, 2025
Theophile Sautory and William Hang explore the advancements of Agent RFT, showcasing how reasoning models are enhanced for real-world tool usage. Topics covered include performance optimization, task setup, live demos, and success case studies from Cognition, Ambience, Genspark, Mako, and Rogo.
6.)
Bubble or No Bubble, AI Keeps Progressing (ft. Relentless Learning + Introspection)
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | November 10, 2025
Focus remains on pivotal advances in AI, particularly in continual learning, a long-held challenge. Insights into models that introspect themselves and recent achievements in image generation highlight the evolving landscape of artificial intelligence.
7.)
Michael Truell: How Cursor Builds at the Speed of AI
| a16z | YouTube.com | November 10, 2025
Cursor CEO Michael Truell and a16z‚Äôs Martin Casado explore innovative strategies behind the rapid development of one of the fastest-growing developer tools. They delve into the unique design constraints that fueled their focus on power users and the transformative two-day work trial process that prioritizes agency over credentials.
8.)
11 Things They‚Äôre NOT Telling You About The New Era of Quantum Computing
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 10, 2025
Exploring the hidden realities of quantum computing, significant developments from tech giants are unveiled, revealing breakthroughs and risks threatening the digital landscape. As quantum supremacy looms, the imminent impacts on security, encryption, and even artificial intelligence are critically examined, showcasing both extraordinary potential and profound challenges ahead.
9.)
Google Warns Of AI Malware Promptflux That Mutates Using LLMS Marking Major Cybersecurity Threat
| DigitalTrends.com | November 10, 2025
So, Google‚Äôs top security, Google‚Äôs Threat Intelligence Group, or GTIG, just found something that is frankly pretty terrifying. It‚Äôs a new type of malware they‚Äôre calling PROMPTFLUX. Get this: this new virus uses the same kind of AI that powers stuff like Google Gemini to rewrite its own code while it‚Äôs attacking. It‚Äôs a shapeshifter. Its whole goal is to constantly change itself so that antivirus programs and security systems can‚Äôt recognise it.
Instead of following a pre-written, fixed script like most malware, this thing can ‚Äúlearn‚Äù and ‚Äúadapt‚Äù on the fly, creating new attack methods as it goes.
10.)
Meta Unveils Open Source Omnilingual ASR AI Model Supporting Transcription In 1,600+ Languages
| Venturebeat.com | November 10, 2025
Meta has just released a new multilingual automatic speech recognition (ASR) system supporting 1,600+ languages, dwarfing OpenAI‚Äôs open source Whisper model, which supports just 99.
11.)
OpenAI Offers Free Year Of ChatGPT Plus To Support U.S. Service Members And Veterans Transitioning
| OpenAI.com | November 10, 2025
Every year, hundreds of thousands of U.S. servicemembers transition from military to civilian life. It‚Äôs a big change with lots of promise, but there‚Äôs also a lot to figure out: job hunting, evaluating education options, navigating earned benefits, housing, finances, and getting used to a new routine. Nearly half of post-9/11 veterans say their adjustment to civilian life was difficult.
November 9, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
12.)
Cultivating An AI Mindset, Part 1
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | November 9, 2025
Explore the transformative potential of an AI mindset that fosters breakthrough results. Through relatable analogies and insights into algorithmic problem-solving, learn how to leverage high-quality data and lateral thinking for superior AI outcomes.
November 8, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
13.)
8 Hour AI Agents Course In 30 Minutes (Deep Learning AI)
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | November 8, 2025
Tina unpacks essential insights on no-code AI agent builders, covering platforms such as StackAI, Relevance AI, and n8n. By the end, viewers will understand which tool best suits their workflow, including automation capabilities and practical applications in various business contexts.
14.)
Perplexity Just Changed How I Use The Internet! (Comet Browser)
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | November 8, 2025
The introduction of Perplexity‚Äôs Comet Browser redefines online experiences, seamlessly integrating AI to enhance productivity. Featuring a built-in assistant and the ability to switch AI models, it showcases practical applications for creators and power users, including efficient research modes, content summarization, and advanced task management.
November 7, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
15.)
AI Job Losses Are Real. Don‚Äôt Panic (Yet).
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
AI‚Äôs impact on employment raises critical questions as major players like OpenAI, led by Sam Altman, explore advancements toward GPT-6 while grappling with financial challenges. Concurrently, Google‚Äôs ventures such as AI chips in space and Gemini‚Äôs integration into Apple Intelligence spark discussions about the future landscape of artificial intelligence and marketing pushbacks.
16.)
AI News: Google‚Äôs Suncatcher, OpenAI TEAR, Apple $1B Deal for Gemini, Vidu Q2, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
Innovations in AI continue to shape the landscape, with significant developments including Google‚Äôs Suncatcher initiative, OpenAI‚Äôs latest agreements, and Apple‚Äôs strategic use of Gemini for Siri. Additionally, this update covers Vidu‚Äôs recent performance, threats to Perplexity from Amazon, and intriguing character appearances in Sora, highlighting the evolving narrative in the AI sector.
17.)
Amjad Masad & Adam D‚ÄôAngelo: How Far Are We From AGI?
| a16z | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
In a thought-provoking discussion, Amjad Masad and Adam D‚ÄôAngelo explore contrasting views on the future of artificial intelligence and its implications for the job market. They delve into the potential for automating remote work and the challenge of understanding intelligence, as well as the socio-economic transformation that might arise from AI advancements.
18.)
How to Use ComfyUI (Generate Images on YOUR Computer) for Beginners
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
Corey and Grant provide a detailed introduction to using ComfyUI, an innovative node-based interface for AI image generation. This tutorial covers installation, understanding workflows, and generating your first image with Flux, equipping beginners with essential skills and tips for effective image generation.
19.)
Kimi K2 Thinking Is Crazy‚Ä¶ (Huge Update)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
Kimi K2 showcases groundbreaking advancements in thinking algorithms, providing insights into performance benchmarks and real-world applications. The presentation highlights the potential of AI-driven solutions, featuring user reactions and practical demonstrations that reveal its transformative capabilities.
20.)
Stop Wasting Money on More AI Tools. Do This Instead
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
Discover how to enhance productivity with effective AI workflows, focusing on popular tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude. This guide outlines eight practical workflows that can help streamline tasks and maximize efficiency in your work processes.
21.)
Teaching Computers to Smell?! The AI Digitizing Scent (ft. Osmo CEO)
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
Alex Wiltschko, Founder & CEO of Osmo, reveals groundbreaking advancements in the digital perception of scent. He shares insights on the intricate connections between smell, emotion, and memory, and discusses how Osmo‚Äôs innovative technology could revolutionize fragrance design and even early cancer detection.
22.)
Use This AI for Your Next Presentation & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | November 7, 2025
Igor unveils the innovative Gemini presentation creation feature, comparing it to other leading tools like Claude. He also analyzes the latest Canva AI updates and delves into the controversy surrounding Coca-Cola‚Äôs AI-generated holiday advertisements.
23.)
OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT Chat Logs Leak Via Google Analytics Raising Concerns Over Web Data Scraping
| Arstechnica.com | November 7, 2025
For months, extremely personal and sensitive ChatGPT conversations have been leaking into an unexpected destination: Google Search Console (GSC), a tool that developers typically use to monitor search traffic, not lurk private chats.
24.)
OpenAI Addresses Prompt Injection Threats With New Research And Enhanced AI Model Safeguards
| OpenAI.com | November 7, 2025
AI tools are starting to do more than respond to questions. They can now browse the web, help with research, plan trips, and help buy products. As they become more capable, with the ability to access your data in other apps and take actions on your behalf, new security challenges emerge. One we‚Äôre heavily focused on is prompt injection.
25.)
Terminal-Bench Unveils Harbor And Terminal-Bench 2.0 For Enhanced AI Testing And Rollouts
| X.com | November 7, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing the next chapter of Terminal-Bench with two releases: 1. Harbor, a new package for running sandboxed agent rollouts at scale. 2. Terminal-Bench 2.0, a harder version of Terminal-Bench with increased verification.
26.)
Kim Kardashian Calls ChatGPT Her Frenemy After Failing Legal Exams Due To AI Advice
| TechCrunch.com | November 7, 2025
Celebrities: They‚Äôre just like us? In a Vanity Fair interview, Kim Kardashian, who has been studying to become a lawyer, discussed her ‚Äútoxic‚Äù friendship with ChatGPT, admitting that she has failed law exams after it told her false information.
27.)
Cointelegraph Reports Rise In AI Trading Bots As Experts Caution They Are Not Foolproof For Investors
| CoinTelegraph.com | November 7, 2025
As AI-powered trading tools gain traction across crypto markets, industry insiders say most traders misunderstand how these models actually work and where their real risks lie.
28.)
Anthropic Expands European Presence With New Offices In Paris And Munich
| Anthropic.com | November 7, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing plans to open offices in Paris and Munich as our global operations expand across Europe. These new hubs follow recent office openings in Tokyo, Seoul, and Bengaluru and will further grow our European footprint alongside our offices in London, Dublin, and Zurich. They‚Äôre the latest example of Anthropic‚Äôs extraordinary momentum in Europe‚Äîand all around the world. In the past year, we have tripled the number of employees we have in the EMEA region and will continue to expand our headcount with the addition of these new offices.
29.)
NBA Backs Fastbreak AI With $40M Investment To Optimize Game Scheduling Using Artificial Intelligence
| Bloomberg.com | November 7, 2025
Fastbreak AI, a firm that specializes in sports scheduling optimization, is raising $40 million in new funding as artificial intelligence services get more integrated into sports leagues around the world.
30.)
NotebookLM Adds Google Drive PDF And Sheets Import; Docx Support Coming Soon
| X.com | November 7, 2025
Your wish is our command (within reason‚Ä¶) PDFs and Sheets can now be imported as sources from Google Drive! DocX support is coming very, very soon. What other source formats do we need to add next? Let us know!
November 6, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
31.)
9 AI Breakthroughs That Shocked Us at TechCrunch Disrupt
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
TechCrunch Disrupt‚Äôs 20th anniversary showcased a remarkable array of AI innovations, from culinary robots to nanotechnology and drone defense systems. Highlighting nine startups that are revolutionizing sectors such as agriculture and coding, this exploration offers a glimpse into the future shaped by artificial intelligence.
32.)
Easiest Way to Build Professional Websites Using AI
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
Igor demonstrates how to leverage 10Web‚Äôs AI-powered website generator to create professional WordPress sites in just minutes. This innovative tool empowers users to build the website of their dreams without extensive time or financial investment.
33.)
Mark Zuckerberg & Priscilla Chan: How AI Will Cure All Disease
| a16z | YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
Priscilla Chan and Mark Zuckerberg outline how the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative is pioneering computational methods to combat disease through innovative projects. They delve into the need for significant funding in basic science and share insights on integrating AI with biology to enhance scientific research and discovery.
34.)
Top 15 New Discoveries Made By AI (Part 3)
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
Artificial Intelligence is revolutionizing fields such as science and technology, unveiling unprecedented discoveries that challenge our understanding of the universe. From new drugs and materials to creative patterns found in nature, these breakthroughs illustrate the profound potential of AI to accelerate innovation and expand human knowledge.
35.)
Veo-3: Insane New Camera Feature & NanoBanana 2!!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
Explore the cutting-edge features of the new Veo-3.1 camera, including experimental tools for adjusting camera positions in previously recorded videos, and insights on the much-anticipated NanoBanana 2. The discussion includes hands-on tests, unique use cases, and a look at how these innovations integrate with Adobe‚Äôs creative ecosystem.
36.)
OpenAI Unveils Teen Safety Blueprint To Build Safer. Empowering AI Experiences For Young Users
| OpenAI.com | November 6, 2025
We are introducing the Teen Safety Blueprint, a roadmap for building AI tools responsibly and a practical starting point for policymakers who are working to set standards for teen use of AI. Young people deserve technology that expands opportunity and protects their well-being. The Blueprint helps define how AI should work for teens, including age-appropriate design, meaningful product safeguards, and ongoing research and evaluation. The decisions made today will shape how teens use and are protected by this technology for years to come.
37.)
OpenAI Shares Recommendations To Guide AI Progress For Broad. Lasting Benefit
| OpenAI.com | November 6, 2025
When the popular conception of the Turing test went whooshing by, many of us thought it was a little strange how much daily life just kept going. This was a milestone people had talked about for decades. It felt impossibly out of reach, then all of a sudden it felt close, then all of a sudden we were on the other side. We got some great new products and not much about the world changed, even though computers can now converse and think about hard problems.
38.)
Ring Launches AI Single Event Alert To Reduce Smart Home Notification Overload
| Blog.ring.com | November 6, 2025
In an increasingly connected world, constant notifications from smart home devices have become part of everyday life. A single activity, like the gardener mowing the lawn or children playing in the driveway, can trigger multiple alerts in just minutes.
39.)
Qwen Unveils Brumby-14B-Base. A New Qwen3 Variant Using Power Retention Beyond Attention Methods
| Venturebeat.com | November 6, 2025
When the transformer architecture was introduced in 2017 in the now seminal Google paper ‚ÄúAttention Is All You Need,‚Äù it became an instant cornerstone of modern artificial intelligence.
40.)
Amazon Tests AI Tool To Automatically Translate Books For Self-Publishing Authors
| Engadget.com | November 6, 2025
This is being advertised as a boon for authors who publish directly on the platform.
41.)
Collins Names Vibe Coding As 2025 Word Of The Year. Spotlighting AI-Powered Software Development
| Blog.collinsdictionary.com | November 6, 2025
Tired of wrestling with syntax? Just go with the vibes. That‚Äôs the essence of vibe coding, Collins‚Äô Word of the Year 2025, a term that captures something fundamental about our evolving relationship with technology. Coined by AI pioneer Andrej Karpathy, vibe coding refers to the use of artificial intelligence prompted by natural language to write computer code. Basically, telling a machine what you want rather than painstakingly coding it yourself. It‚Äôs programming by vibes, not variables. While tech experts debate whether it‚Äôs revolutionary or reckless, the term has resonated far beyond Silicon Valley, speaking to a broader cultural shift towards AI-assisted everything in everyday life.
42.)
Sandbar Unveils Stream Ring. An AI-Powered Wearable For Instant Voice Notes
| Engadget.com | November 6, 2025
It‚Äôs the debut product from Sandbar, a company formed by two former Meta employees.
43.)
Higgsfield AI Unveils Recast. Revolutionizing Video Content With Advanced AI Features
| X.com | November 6, 2025
Video character swap PERFECTED. Introducing Higgsfield Recast. 1-click full-body replacement with flawless gesture tracking + voice cloning + multi-language dubbing & background transformation.
44.)
Microsoft AI Unveils Vision For Humanist Superintelligence Focused On Human-Centric AI Development
| Microsoft.ai | November 6, 2025
A humanist future. Here‚Äôs a question that‚Äôs not getting the attention it deserves: what kind of AI does the world really want? I think it‚Äôs probably the most important question of our time.
45.)
Google Expands Opal Availability To Over 160 Countries Worldwide
| Blog.google | November 6, 2025
Earlier this year, Google Labs released Opal, a no-code way to develop mini-apps. Today, we‚Äôre expanding Opal from 15 countries to more than 160 countries so users can create AI mini-apps without writing any code. From automating tasks to analyzing data, there are countless ways we‚Äôve seen people try Opal. Here‚Äôs a closer look at just a few examples.
46.)
Google Launches File Search. A Fully Managed RAG System Integrated Into The Gemini API
| Blog.google | November 6, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre launching the File Search Tool, a fully managed RAG system built directly into the Gemini API that abstracts away the retrieval pipeline so you can focus on building. File Search provides a simple, integrated and scalable way to ground Gemini with your data, delivering responses that are more accurate, relevant and verifiable.
47.)
Google Finance Launches AI-Powered Deep Search And Prediction Market Tools For Investment Research
| Blog.google | November 6, 2025
The latest upgrades to Google Finance will help you make sense of the financial world, with Deep Search, prediction markets data and live earnings features.
48.)
Meta Launches New AI App In Europe. Enabling Users To Create. Share. And Play In Innovative Ways
| About.fb.com | November 6, 2025
The new Meta AI app launches today across Europe, introducing the Vibes feed and placing creative media sharing and AI-powered features at the heart of your experience.
49.)
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang And Chief Scientist Bill Dally Win Queen Elizabeth Prize For Engineering
| Blogs.nvidia.com | November 6, 2025
The duo were honored for their pioneering work in accelerated computing, foundational to modern AI.
50.)
SS Innovations Completes First Telesurgery Using New Compact SSI Mantra Surgeon Command Center
| TheRobotReport.com | November 6, 2025
SS Innovations International Inc. today said it has completed the first telesurgery with its SSi Mantra Tele Surgeon Console, or TSC. The company unveiled the system in 2024 and has since made a number of technological refinements.
51.)
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Denies Seeking Government Guarantees For Datacenters
| X.com | November 6, 2025
I would like to clarify a few things. First, the obvious one: we do not have or want government guarantees for OpenAI datacenters. We believe that governments should not pick winners or losers, and that taxpayers should not bail out companies that make bad business decisions or otherwise lose in the market.  If one company fails, other companies will do good work.
52.)
OpenAI Launches Peloton And Tripadvisor Apps On ChatGPT
| X.com | November 6, 2025
OpenAI announces that ‚ÄúApps in ChatGPT‚Äù are live for logged-in users outside the EU on Free, Go, Plus, and Pro, showcasing integrations like Coursera, Expedia, Figma, Spotify, Zillow, Booking.com, and Canva. On November 6, 2025, it adds Peloton and Tripadvisor to the lineup.
53.)
Perplexity Launches New Comet Assistant With Updates And Tips For Enhanced User Experience
| Perplexity.ai | November 6, 2025
When we first launched Comet in July, we learned one thing right away. Users love the Comet Assistant. It‚Äôs a helper that follows you around, answers questions, and does work for you.
54.)
LiveAvatar By Heygen Launches Hyper-Realistic Real-Time Interactive Avatars
| X.com | November 6, 2025
Today, we are proud to introduce LiveAvatar by HeyGen. It was built alongside visionary customers already using it to shape the future of AI. LiveAvatar offers hyper-realistic, real-time interactive avatars that enable face-to-face human conversation experiences on demand, and at scale.
55.)
Krea AI Unveils ‚ÄòKrea Nodes‚Äô. Offering Unified Interface For Enhanced User Experience
| X.com | November 6, 2025
Introducing Krea Nodes. Our most powerful tool to date; all Krea in one interface.
56.)
Kimi.ai Unveils Open-Source Thinking Agent Model With Advanced Capabilities
| X.com | November 6, 2025
Built as a thinking agent, K2 Thinking marks our latest efforts in test-time scaling, scaling both thinking tokens and tool-calling turns.
57.)
Xpeng Unveils Next-Gen Iron Humanoid Robot At 2025 AI Day
| YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
Transcend the boundary between tradition and the future, and step into a new realm of possibility.
58.)
Xpeng Unveils Robotaxi Concept At AI Day As Intelligent Travel Companion
| YouTube.com | November 6, 2025
It‚Äôs no longer just transportation, it‚Äôs a companion that understands you.
November 5, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
59.)
New LTX-2 Feature & Real Time AI Video!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | November 5, 2025
LTX Studio‚Äôs latest updates on 22-second video generation and the innovative ‚ÄúElements‚Äù feature are reshaping the landscape of AI filmmaking. The exploration of real-time video generation with Odyssey ML 2 showcases both its potential and wackiness, opening new doors for creative expression in AI technology.
60.)
Seeing The Future From AI Companions To Personal Software
| a16z | YouTube.com | November 5, 2025
Eugenia Kuyda, CEO of Wabi and a leader in AI development, shares insights on the evolution of personal software through the lens of creative ownership. Her discussion touches on the transition from traditional command-line interfaces to accessible mini-apps, potential shifts in software creation, and the importance of deep personalization in the software landscape.
61.)
Unitree Robotics Unveils Full-Body Teleoperation Embodied-Avatar Platform
| YouTube.com | November 5, 2025
Everyone has fantasized about having an embodied avatar! Full-body teleoperation and full-body data acquisition platform is waiting for you to try it out!
62.)
Snapchat To Integrate Perplexity AI For In-Chat Q&A And Idea Exploration Starting In Early 2026
| X.com | November 5, 2025
Starting in early 2026, you‚Äôll be able to ask questions, explore new ideas, and get credible answers right inside chat.
63.)
OpenAI Enhances GPT-5 Pro. Interrupt And Refine Long Queries Without Losing Progress
| X.com | November 5, 2025
You can now interrupt long-running queries and add new context without restarting or losing progress. This is especially useful for refining deep research or GPT-5 Pro queries as the model will adjust its response with your new requirements. Just hit update in the sidebar and type in any additional details or clarifications.
64.)
Techxplore Unveils Human Photo Dataset To Help Detect AI Biases In Computer Vision Models
| TechXplore.com | November 5, 2025
A database of more than 10,000 human images to evaluate biases in artificial intelligence (AI) models for human-centric computer vision is presented in Nature this week. The Fair Human-Centric Image Benchmark (FHIBE), developed by Sony AI, is an ethically sourced, consent-based dataset that can be used to evaluate human-centric computer vision tasks to identify and correct biases and stereotypes.
65.)
OpenAI Seeks US Loan Guarantees To Support $1 Trillion AI Infrastructure Expansion
| InvestingLive.com | November 5, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs pursuit of government-backed financing underscores the escalating cost of AI infrastructure and the growing overlap between tech investment and public-sector support. The move could reshape funding models for large-scale AI projects and signal broader state involvement in the sector.
66.)
Apple To Pay Google $1 Billion Annually To Power Siri With 1.2 Trillion Parameter AI Model
| Bloomberg.com | November 5, 2025
Apple Inc. is planning to pay about $1 billion a year for an ultrapowerful 1.2 trillion parameter artificial intelligence model developed by Alphabet Inc.‚Äôs Google that would help run its long-promised overhaul of the Siri voice assistant, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
67.)
Google Announces Enhanced Structured Outputs For Developers In The Gemini API
| Blog.google | November 5, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing enhancements to Structured Outputs in the Gemini API, with expanded support for JSON Schema and better adherence to property ordering in the output.
